comment: She is wonderful, truly. In her online poetry writing workshop, she gives tons of feedback and is super kind and helpful to students. She responds quickly to emails and is willing to work with you when you're struggling. The work is fun and allows you to improve your skills. I would take her again.
Expect high expectations in this poetry class, but Professor Sadre-Orafai makes it worthwhile. Attend every session, engage, and utilize unstuck AI for study prep - you'll grow as a writer.

8-week course: 8 check-ins (no length), 4 free-writes & 3 reading reflections (250 words), 5 poems, poem feedback for those in your group (150 words, typically 9-11 people in the 5 weeks). Workshop format, no tests, and completion grading besides the artist portfolio (2-page analysis, rough and final draft poems) Loved her, just don't be lazy.

Professor Sadre-Orafai takes expectations to a new level. In an 8 week poetry class, we wrote 5 poems, and had to write roughly 1500 words of prose commenting on classmates poems. The worst part is that if you are even a single word short for your comment on poetry the entire 1499 word assignment is a 0% without any leniency. Absolute nightmare.

DO NOT TAKE HER. Her directions are unclear and she gives either a zero or 100. There is no in-between. If you've done half of the assignments correct and missed a few, you will NOT get partial credit. It will be a straight zero. Also, you will wait for a response from her. She may be better for other classes, but for eng 1102. BEWARE.

I took this professor in Spring of 2021 and she was one of my top favorite teachers ever. I am actually taking her again for next Spring. She makes the work interesting and she allows a lot of creative freedom. I highly suggest taking her if you love writing poetry!

At the beginning of the fall semester, I had a different professor then the professor switched to her within the first month. The lesson plans were already planned out and she stuck to them. I had a whole week to finish an assignment and she seemed nice if I had any questions. Honestly, it was an easy A.

Jenny Sadre-Orafai was one of my favorite professors. She is relatable and inspiring. The class is not too difficult. I hadn't written any poetry before this class, but she gave us examples of why some poems work and others do not, so I had an idea of what kind of poems I wanted to write. It was not easy, but I was inspired and motivated.

Great professor. You have to attended. Its mandatory and counts as a pretty heavy part of your grade. She facilitated great conversations and creativity. Impress her by googling the bios of poets in the reading packets... she likes it when you are invested in the class.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Gives good feedback--Graded by few things

comment: Most of the grades are based on essays but the professor isn't a harsh grader. You have to complete multiple drafts of your essays (The 1st gets feedback from her, the 2nd is reviewed by your group, then you do the final draft). Not a hard class to pass but you should be prepared to put in work and write.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Group projects--So many papers

comment: This woman is rude. Period. She is very condescending and it takes a lot of effort not to completely curse her out. She says her class is a safe space but I consistently see her as well as classmates judge and tear down other peoples poems (not just annotate) when they have little experience with poetry. Her judgement is way above her pay grade!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: I took this professor through an online course and she was a pain. You have papers due every single week & her feedback does no good when you go back to review your paper. Her attitude is terrible especially when you try and ask her questions on her feedback. Although I got an "A" in the course this was by far the worst professor ever.

Don't take her. Her feedback is so condescending that she makes you feel less than her. She catches quick attitudes whenever you ask questions & she makes smart remarks. She doesn't take late work. She also doesn't even care if you are having complications going on & she acts like her class is the only class you have with all the work we had to do.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: Professor Sadre-Orafai has been my favorite instructor at KSU. She is so brilliant, talented, and genuinely passionate about poetry. If you put in the effort, she will help you grow and improve as a writer. Definitely take her if you want to push against your comfort zone.

Be prepared to type a lot of papers. Drafts due each week, following reviewing and editing two of your classmates' papers. Rubric is always provided and detailed. Make sure to reach the page requirement and stray from grammatical errors and you'll be fine. She is quick at responding to emails if you have any questions.
seems standoffish at first and kind of judgmental but she really is a great teacher
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: I've always enjoyed the writing process, but research papers and MLA aren't my cup of tea. Lucky for me, I got to take Prof. S. As long as you do all of the readings, research (choose a topic you really love - or you'll regret it), and copious amounts of editing, you should do fine. The peer reviewing saved my sanity, as did the class's structure.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Participation matters--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: This professor is amazing. She gave excellent feedback on all assignments, and will help you with anything. My writing definitely got better bc of this class. She replies to emails quickly, and is very thoughtful. Although it was online, I felt like the student-teacher interaction was better than it being in-class. Take her if you get the chance!

Best teacher/class I've had at KSU. She gives great suggestions with what to do with your work. Offers students help when they ask for it and tells them the truth when they need to hear it.  If you don't show up to class you will pass but you will miss out on a lot. Don't get your feelings hurt if she doesn't like your work, just keep an open mind.
My writing improved in this course.

She is a great teacher, but prepared to write. She will tell you upfront that she believes that writing is the way to get better at writing. You will write 2 drafts for each paper during the semester, with a final and 3rd draft for a final portfolio. Be sure to read the textbook and all materials provided by her and you will do fine.

She is a great teacher! This was my first online class. She clearly states the assignments and if you have questions, she responds quickly. As far as discussions, there are none besides introducing yourself the first day. As long as you do the essay, you get a 100, same with all other assignments. Easy easy A.

Awesome teacher for discussing the literature that is required to read. She gets people involved and takes everyones opinion into consideration. However, the 4 papers that you have to write on the literature are graded very harshly, and no matter how hard you try they never seem to live up to her expectations. Blog posts & 2 easy tests.

She is very helpful and quick to respond to emails. 4 Major projects & a few small assignments. All assignments are graded based on if you turned it in or not except final portfolio. Final Portfolio 60% of your grade includes 3 final drafts. Would recommend taking this teacher especially online!

Your poetry will not receive a good grade unless you write poetry the way she wants you to. I received a good grade in her class however, it would have been higher if I had been a mindless person and bowed to her request and edited my poems to sound the way she wanted it. At some point you have to recognize critique & just being her puppet.
She only thinks that her opinion matters and if you try to write poetry in her class she thinks that it has to be as good as hers and not anything else.

She is awesome. Her class is very straight forward and is easy if you do the work. There's no textbook, but you have to read the texts she picks. I really enjoyed her class and her tests were pretty easy. Take her!
She tells you what she wants, and she grades fairly. The class was straight forward and well enough, but I just didn't like her. Something about here I just didn't like.

Do not take her. She is condescending even through an email. She is not open to new ideas and is stubborn. Makes students use Galileo which is a pathetic database. This is the second time I've taken this class with her which was the biggest mistake. Professors are supposed to help not make students feel inferior.

Fairly easy, simple, and typical 1102 class. So glad I took online. She is organized, responds promptly to e-mails, and has everything laid out very clearly. I'd suggest going to the writing center wen working on final drafts. I think this is why I got an A. Highly recommend.

One of the best professors I've ever had. Attendance is not mandatory but if you want to understand anything in the course you need to attend class. Wide range of course material (world lit) and her in class discussions legitimately make you think. Out of 8 books read 4 require essays. 2 tests and in class participation points are rewarded.
Great teacher, attendance is mandatory.  Grades hard on papers but grades easy on tests. Over all nice teacher.
She's awesome! Definitely recommend. Go to class. Take notes. Pay attention. The blog posts are important. Laptop recommended for this class.

one of the hardest teachers I've ever had - but good at what she does.  Took the online class - probably the best of all the online classes I have taken (If that's your preference) but I would definitely recommend taking her actual class.

Took her online. She is probably one of the most organized and helpful professors I have ever had in an online setting. She responds to emails quickly and is willing to meet with you over the phone or in person. 4 "projects" with 2 drafts for each and the third draft is 60% of your grade. I definitely recommend her.

Took her online. VERY helpful and responds to emails very quickly. Fairly easy class. There are only 4 papers, all on one topic chosen at the beginning of the semester. Choose your topic wisely. Curious Researcher is the only book needed. I would definitely recommend this class!

Easy class provided you attend and know how to read and write reasonably well, but despite being relatively attractive, Ms. Sadre-Orafai isn't the most pleasant or cheerful person, and she doesn't know how to talk without saying "um" or "like" every few words. There are too many expensive books to buy, also, and they aren't worth the money.

Easy online class! 4 papers. Only book used: Curious Researcher. Final portfolio is combo of 4 papers and 60% of grade. The bad things: I didnt know how she would grade portfolio since everything else was graded for completion and this was based on content. And I never got back my final portfolio grade! Only knew I got A in class from owl express.

Ms. Sadre-Orafai is an awesome teacher. She's very helpful and she understands that many people absolutely hate writing papers. We had to write 4 papers on the same subject the entire semester. Please make sure you chose something that is interesting. Stay focused and turn in papers on time and you will pass.She will answer any questions you have.
She is a great teacher! You have to buy a lot of books but some you can find online for free! She is funny and very engaging! loved her! the 4 papers were annoying but do-able !

ENG 1102 is the groundhog course! you write on the same topic all semester, choose carefully something you can argue a side on. The book is less formal however the assignments REQUIRE academic writing within a specific structure. I took online summer semester, workload was quite heavy for summer but can't imagine 16 weeks of this class. GREAT Prof!

Took online, she is very organized, explains directions well, answers emails fast, gives you encouragement, four papers to do, must keep up & turn papers in on time, final drafts of all papers are due at end of semester. I would recommend her. She is great!!

Good at what she does, very good.  Also very difficult, but a great teacher at it - I hate this stuff, but I ended with a lot more skill at writing papers.  She is EXTREMELY helpful and responsive, and never negative.  The book sucks, but I think all the teachers have to use the same book.

Took her online course and came out with a B.  Four major papers, all graded for completion, then due together as a 'portfolio' at the end for a grading based on what you learned over the semester.  Pretty easy, so long as you're not a procrastinator.
Easy A! Class is like a book club. 8 Req. readings and all of them are interesting,4 three page papers,and an online blog for each reading. Come to class to get an A.

I took her class online, turned out to be a success= A! but you have to work your but off and don't procrastinate! you have to choose a topic to work on the entire semester.. choose wisely! do not pick one that you are going to find research on. Overall, she is a good professor and take her!

Took class online, she's EXTREMELY helpful & clear. Very organized. 4 writing projects (1  is research paper) - all grades are for completion except for "final portfolio" which  is graded for content. My 1st online class & I would highly recommend her! It's a lot of work, research, and writing, but shes very helpful, would definitely take her again

Well. maybe it was the mixture of the online and her teaching that was not so good, I ended up making a B as a final grade but I never got to see what my final paper grade was. ALOT OF WRITING AND RESEARCH! I felt she predetermined my grade bc I had issues from the beg. bc she didnt like my topic of research, about menopause. All papers r peer edit

A LOT of reading required for this class. Need to buy 5 or so books. She is hot and she knows it. Pretty stuck up and can be condescending. Not a class you can breeze through, get ready to read your ass off and discuss homer until you want to jump off a bridge. Should teach a poetry class, she loves her own and will let you know about it.

Very engaging class, but I'd only recommend it for those who are serious about writing. Write 4 papers throughout the semseter with plenty of opportunity for feedback. She gives you a checklist of things to improve. Do everything, and you're guaranteed an A. Just watch out. If your portfolio is 1 minute late, you fail the class. I'm not kidding.

I really enjoyed taking her class.. it was interesting. She is a little condescending to her students.. or at the very least me.. She could be more open to suggestions and I wish I would of had more feedback on my papers.. all in all I really wish she would consider teaching a higher level English.. maybe poetry
I like her a lot. She takes attendance... and do the reading. It's not really a chore though, the books she assigns for the second half of the course are all really interesting. Uses powerpoints.
i failed, but thats my own fault. i was late turning in my final portfolio. she is a very easy teacher and is willing to help. just dont f**k up your final portfolio. plus shes hot.

She is tough, but fair. Made be earn my B and I am a better writer for it. Took her online, which was lot of work. English is not my best subject, but she worked with me. Hand in all your work on time and you should get an A or B.

She is a tough teacher but you truly learn! When I turned in my portfolio at the end of the semester, it was the first time since high school I could not form a sentence when I finally met her! Very hot!
LOVED HER! I took her online class and loved it! I think she provided answers if you asked! She did not hand you everything on a silver platter though! LOVE HER!!
I took her online course & loved it. She is great & very helpful & as long as you do all your work & submit it on time you'll do great. I got an A. I wish I could have her again...
Jenny is amazing.

She is the BEST teacher! You only have to write 4 papers and you only turn in 3 at the end of the semester in your final portfolio. That's 60% of your grade. She isn't incredibly easy, you have to work for your grade. But she is funny and makes the class a lot of fun. She only gives out a few A's, but a lot of B's. I'm taking her for 1102 too.

She rocks! There were basically 4 papers. Only three of them are actually turned in in a portfolio at the end of the semester worth 60% of your grade. She basically goes over each paper with you and helps you make the necessary corrections. I got an A, but its not really an "easy A". You have to put forth the effort and work hard.

I'm a decent writer but this course was hard! I saw the comments on here & took her class online. She didn't offer specific feedback but was a VERY strict grader! She required you write 3 versions of 4 essays, peer review, write 12 draft analysis, & do weekly HW assignments! I turned in everything on time & barely made an A. I don't recommend her.

This was a great class and a GREAT professor. I took the online course and her comments were very, very helpful.  She seemed to go out of her way to make sure that we understood the material.  The grade was based on a final portfolio of our work through the course. We have two chances to modify each of our papers.  My best professor ever.
I took her online class, and it was so easy. The only thing you actually get graded on is your final portfolio, everything else is just turn it in, get the points.

THE BEST TEACHER EVER!!!! she makes writting fun!!!!I am an international student my self and she devotes her time and will do anything to help you understand the materials.  I took her for 1101 and 1102 and made As on both.  I encourage you to take her because she is THE teacher!!! If you like skipping classes....please don't bother to take this c

Very helpful teacher. I have never got anything higher than a low B in an English class, but I got an A in her class. Very easy to understand and always avalible to help. Also, makes the class fun by telling funny stories.
She's amazing. So helpful and full of knowledge. I loved going to her class. She's very helpful and will do anything to make sure you pass!

This class is very easy. The entire semester you choose a research topic to write on and you will write 3 to 4 page short papaers and in the end create a portfolio and turn it in. She helps you with your paper and helps them make into an "A" paper. Very Easy!!!!!!!!!!
you cannot turn in your paper late even one minute or you will get a failing grade
she is awesome.I recommend her to everyone taking an english class. She makes you understand. She is striked but easy to get a A.
She is a great teacher!  She is very easy but at the same time you learn alot!  You write four papers and have conferences about each of them.  You don't know your grade till end of semester though.

She's pretty easy, all you really have to do is write 4 papers and she does one-on-one conferences with you and then at the end of the semester you turn in 3 of the 4 for your grade. The only bad thing is that you don't know your grade until the end of the semester.

She is amazing! she has one on one conferences about your paper before you turn them in at the end of the semester. You only write 4 papers and turn in 3. Participate and show up for class and you'll do well!
So easy. You do not have tests or quizzes. We only write four papers all year and she will grade three of them. Show up for class, participate, and act interested and she will give you an A.
As long as you write exactly like she tells you and put her examples in your papers she will love you and hand you an A.
Very nice and personable. I have absolutely no complaints!!!
she is not supposed to be teaching in international students class... she is unpatient, not willing too spend much time with you... not helpfull at all...
AMAZING teacher! I will be taking her for 1102.
This professor was very helpful, all you have to do is ask for help or her opinion and she will give it to you straight up.
HORRIBLE, she is the wrong teacher for international students
She aight. Treats u like a kid sometime, but it's koo. The easier the better.
Best English teacher i've ever had.  She walks you through every step of the class and practically hands you an A.  Show up for class, do what she tells you, and you will make a good grade.
so glad that I took her for 1101 and 1102. very pleased.  just make sure that you be on time for class. thats all she asks.  so sweeeeeeeet.
I don't think she is that nice. Wrong person to teach international student class. She is absolutely rude and unprofessional. Too personal, too emotional.
she is kewl, she is fun, just go to her class on time, and do everything she tells you too, there is no way you will get less than a 'A'
She is awesome. I loved the class. Probably the easiest English class Ive ever had.
coolest teacher ever! she is so fun, she loves new ideas, and she is very encouraging. she takes personal time for each student and gives you time in class to work on papers. she is the best!
Very helpful loved having her as a teacher.  A great way to start my college life with an easy going teacher.  She will help you in anyway possible.  The individual help is awesome!
she is the sweetest thing in the world.
This woman is one of the most talented teachers you will ever have. She's very patient & even more understanding. It's nice to have a teacher who actually cares about you.
Hands down the greatest college professor you will ever have.  Take her any chance you get, in fact determine your schedule around her class, you will be thankful.
No Comments
Will drop anything to help you; she's still young, so she's very understanding
